e,"name":"_jobId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_invoiceId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_approver","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"InvoiceAccepted","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"name":"_jobId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_changer","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_issuers","type":"address[]"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_approvers","type":"address[]"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_ipfsHash","type":"string"}],"name":"JobChanged","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"name":"_jobId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_changer","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_issuers","type":"address[]"}],"name":"JobIssuersUpdated","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"name":"_jobId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_changer","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_approvers","type":"address[]"}],"name":"JobApproversUpdated","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"name":"_jobId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_changer","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_ipfsHash","type":"string"}],"name":"JobDataChanged","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"name":"_jobId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_candidate","type":"address"}],"name":"CandidateAccepted","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"name":"_sender","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_jobId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_invoiceId","type":"uint256"}],"name":"InvoiceCancelled","type":"event"}],"devdoc":{"author":"Mark Beylin <mark.beylin@consensys.net>, Gon\u00e7alo S\u00e1 <goncalo.sa@consensys.net>, Kevin Owocki <kevin.owocki@consensys.net>, Ricardo Guilherme Schmidt (@3esmit), Matt Garnett <matt.garnett@consensys.net>, Craig Williams <craig.williams@consensys.net>","details":"A contract for issuing jobs on Ethereum paying in ETH, ERC20, or ERC721 tokens","methods":{"acceptInvoice(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"acceptInvoice(): Allows any of the approvers to accept a given submission","params":{"_approverId":"the index of the approver which is making the call","_invoiceId":"the index of the invoice to be accepted","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"addApprovers(address,uint256,uint256,address[])":{"details":"addApprovers(): Allows any of the issuers to add more approvers to the job","params":{"_approvers":"the array of addresses to add to the list of valid approvers","_issuerId":"the index of the issuer who is calling the function","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"addIssuers(address,uint256,uint256,address[])":{"details":"addIssuers(): Allows any of the issuers to add more issuers to the job","params":{"_issuerId":"the index of the issuer who is calling the function","_issuers":"the array of addresses to add to the list of valid issuers","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"cancelInvoice(address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"cancelInvoice(): Allows the sender of the invoice to cancel it","params":{"_invoiceId":"the index of the invoice to be accepted","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"changeApprover(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,address)":{"details":"changeApprover(): Allows any of the issuers to change a particular approver of the job","params":{"_approver":"the address of the new approver","_approverId":"the index of the approver who is being changed","_issuerId":"the index of the issuer who is calling the function","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"changeData(address,uint256,uint256,string)":{"details":"changeData(): Allows any of the issuers to change the data the job","params":{"_ipfsHash":"the new IPFS hash representing the JSON object storing the details of the job (see docs for schema details)","_issuerId":"the index of the issuer who is calling the function","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"changeIssuer(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,address)":{"details":"changeIssuer(): Allows any of the issuers to change a particular issuer of the job","params":{"_issuerId":"the index of the issuer who is calling the function","_issuerIdToChange":"the index of the issuer who is being changed","_jobId":"the index of the job","_newIssuer":"the address of the new issuer","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"changeJob(address,uint256,uint256,address[],address[],string)":{"details":"changeJob(): Allows any of the issuers to change the job","params":{"_approvers":"the new array of addresses who will be the approvers of the job","_ipfsHash":"the new IPFS hash representing the JSON object storing the details of the job (see docs for schema details)","_issuerId":"the index of the issuer who is calling the function","_issuers":"the new array of addresses who will be the issuers of the job","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"contribute(address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"contribute(): Allows users to contribute tokens to a given job.                    Contributing merits no privelages to administer the                    funds in the job or accept submissions. Contributions                    has elapsed, and the job has not yet paid out any funds.                    All funds deposited in a job are at the mercy of a                    job's issuers and approvers, so please be careful!","params":{"_amount":"the amount of tokens being contributed","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"drainJob(address,uint256,uint256,uint256[])":{"details":"drainJob(): Allows an issuer to drain the funds from the job","params":{"_amounts":"an array of amounts of tokens to be sent. The length of the array should be 1 if the job is in ETH or ERC20 tokens. If it's an ERC721 job, the array should be the list of tokenIDs.","_issuerId":"the index of the issuer who is making the call","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"getJob(uint256)":{"details":"getJob(): Returns the details of the job","params":{"_jobId":"the index of the job"},"return":"Returns a tuple for the job"},"invoiceAndAccept(address,uint256,address,string,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"invoiceAndAccept(): Allows any of the approvers to invoice and accept a submission simultaneously","params":{"_approverId":"the index of the approver which is making the call","_invoiceIssuer":"the array of addresses which will receive payouts for the submission","_ipfsHash":"the IPFS hash corresponding to a JSON object which contains the details of the submission (see docs for schema details)","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"invoiceJob(address,uint256,address,string,uint256)":{"details":"invoiceJob(): Allows users to invoice the job to get paid out","params":{"_invoiceIssuer":"The invoice issuer, the addresses which will receive payouts for the submission","_ipfsHash":"the IPFS hash corresponding to a JSON object which contains the details of the submission (see docs for schema details)","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"issueAndContribute(address,address[],address[],string,address,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_depositAmount":"the amount of tokens being deposited to the job, which will create a new contribution to the job"}},"issueJob(address,address[],address[],string,address,uint256)":{"details":"issueJob(): creates a new job","params":{"_approvers":"the array of addresses who will be the approvers of the job","_ipfsHash":"the IPFS hash representing the JSON object storing the details of the job (see docs for schema details)","_issuers":"the array of addresses who will be the issuers of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)","_token":"the address of the token which will be used for the job","_tokenVersion":"the version of the token being used for the job (0 for ETH, 20 for ERC20, 721 for ERC721)"}},"refundContribution(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"refundContribution(): Allows users to refund the contributions they've                            made to a particular job, but only if the job                            has not yet paid out","params":{"_contributionId":"the index of the contribution being refunded","_issuerId":"the issuer id for thre job","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"refundContributions(address,uint256,uint256,uint256[])":{"details":"refundContributions(): Allows users to refund their contributions in bulk","params":{"_contributionIds":"the array of indexes of the contributions being refunded","_issuerId":"the index of the issuer who is making the call","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"refundMyContributions(address,uint256,uint256,uint256[])":{"details":"refundMyContributions(): Allows users to refund their contributions in bulk","params":{"_contributionIds":"the array of indexes of the contributions being refunded","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"replaceApprovers(address,uint256,uint256,address[])":{"details":"replaceApprovers(): Allows any of the issuers to replace the approvers of the job","params":{"_approvers":"the array of addresses to replace the list of valid approvers","_issuerId":"the index of the issuer who is calling the function","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"replaceIssuers(address,uint256,uint256,address[])":{"details":"replaceIssuers(): Allows any of the issuers to replace the issuers of the job","params":{"_issuerId":"the index of the issuer who is calling the function","_issuers":"the array of addresses to replace the list of valid issuers","_jobId":"the index of the job","_sender":"the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)"}},"setMetaTxRelayer(address)":{"details":"setMetaTxRelayer(): Sets the address of the meta transaction relayer","params":{"_relayer":"the address of the relayer"}}},"title":"EthlanceJob"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"drainJob(address,uint256,uint256,uint256[])":{"notice":"when using this function, if an issuer doesn't drain the entire balance, some users may be able to refund their contributions, while others may not (which is unfair to them). Please use it wisely, only when necessary"}}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/Users/jeff/ethlance-subgraph/contracts/EthlanceJobs.sol":"EthlanceJobs"},"evmVersion":"petersburg","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/Users/jeff/ethlance-subgraph/contracts/EthlanceJobs.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8dd46af0fc5c3d2f48de6e4107ad0c2a7a7c4da95573e13f35b62ca8ca29ee87","urls":["bzzr://4286b9ad5ae0e679c3517dd2982e758084f80f7d817d9001f2b32fb22224b0d8"]},"/Users/jeff/ethlance-subgraph/contracts/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe5d8cd08906f65f67852cf4c049f5031e1096f056e349014233ccfabbb7d4c64","urls":["bzzr://0c55e08023008456efb8b2bcf364e4fa351bd7430cee72ad1c88817e2d5847e1"]},"/Users/jeff/ethlance-subgraph/contracts/IERC721.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8f2350fa49dfb95aa73d9642f0cd5764faed42307855411e6e7e9a9a5a0f3084","urls":["bzzr://fd36c3a829a8d9d2e5295ec191f71510a5cf397d890e7953c213e048c229d661"]},"/Users/jeff/ethlance-subgraph/contracts/SafeMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6d4016a7113f43579513d75b3d5281cf9fc43c8e7d3870c13b2731cf05cc6022","urls":["bzzr://073e3e242a1e10f9f35c2f2c957d03cf5e5ae65babebbcc1568c6025375352cd"]}},"version":1}

devdoc.author: Mark Beylin <mark.beylin@consensys.net>, Gonalo S <goncalo.sa@consensys.net>, Kevin Owocki <kevin.owocki@consensys.net>, Ricardo Guilherme Schmidt (@3esmit), Matt Garnett <matt.garnett@consensys.net>, Craig Williams <craig.williams@consensys.net>
devdoc.details: A contract for issuing jobs on Ethereum paying in ETH, ERC20, or ERC721 tokens

acceptInvoice(address,uint256,uint256,ui.details: acceptInvoice(): Allows any of the approvers to accept a given submission

params._approverId: the index of the approver which is making the call
params._invoiceId: the index of the invoice to be accepted
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

addApprovers(address,uint256,uint256,add.details: addApprovers(): Allows any of the issuers to add more approvers to the job

params._approvers: the array of addresses to add to the list of valid approvers
params._issuerId: the index of the issuer who is calling the function
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

addIssuers(address,uint256,uint256,addre.details: addIssuers(): Allows any of the issuers to add more issuers to the job

params._issuerId: the index of the issuer who is calling the function
params._issuers: the array of addresses to add to the list of valid issuers
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

cancelInvoice(address,uint256,uint256).details: cancelInvoice(): Allows the sender of the invoice to cancel it

params._invoiceId: the index of the invoice to be accepted
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

changeApprover(address,uint256,uint256,u.details: changeApprover(): Allows any of the issuers to change a particular approver of the job

params._approver: the address of the new approver
params._approverId: the index of the approver who is being changed
params._issuerId: the index of the issuer who is calling the function
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

changeData(address,uint256,uint256,strin.details: changeData(): Allows any of the issuers to change the data the job

params._ipfsHash: the new IPFS hash representing the JSON object storing the details of the job (see docs for schema details)
params._issuerId: the index of the issuer who is calling the function
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

changeIssuer(address,uint256,uint256,uin.details: changeIssuer(): Allows any of the issuers to change a particular issuer of the job

params._issuerId: the index of the issuer who is calling the function
params._issuerIdToChange: the index of the issuer who is being changed
params._newIssuer: the address of the new issuer
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

changeJob(address,uint256,uint256,addres.details: changeJob(): Allows any of the issuers to change the job

params._approvers: the new array of addresses who will be the approvers of the job
params._ipfsHash: the new IPFS hash representing the JSON object storing the details of the job (see docs for schema details)
params._issuerId: the index of the issuer who is calling the function
params._issuers: the new array of addresses who will be the issuers of the job
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

contribute(address,uint256,uint256).details: contribute(): Allows users to contribute tokens to a given job.                    Contributing merits no privelages to administer the                    funds in the job or accept submissions. Contributions                    has elapsed, and the job has not yet paid out any funds.                    All funds deposited in a job are at the mercy of a                    job's issuers and approvers, so please be careful!

params._amount: the amount of tokens being contributed
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

drainJob(address,uint256,uint256,uint256.details: drainJob(): Allows an issuer to drain the funds from the job

params._amounts: an array of amounts of tokens to be sent. The length of the array should be 1 if the job is in ETH or ERC20 tokens. If it's an ERC721 job, the array should be the list of tokenIDs.
params._issuerId: the index of the issuer who is making the call
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

getJob(uint256).details: getJob(): Returns the details of the job
getJob(uint256).return: Returns a tuple for the job

invoiceAndAccept(address,uint256,address.details: invoiceAndAccept(): Allows any of the approvers to invoice and accept a submission simultaneously

params._approverId: the index of the approver which is making the call
params._invoiceIssuer: the array of addresses which will receive payouts for the submission
params._ipfsHash: the IPFS hash corresponding to a JSON object which contains the details of the submission (see docs for schema details)
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

invoiceJob(address,uint256,address,strin.details: invoiceJob(): Allows users to invoice the job to get paid out

params._invoiceIssuer: The invoice issuer, the addresses which will receive payouts for the submission
params._ipfsHash: the IPFS hash corresponding to a JSON object which contains the details of the submission (see docs for schema details)
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

params._depositAmount: the amount of tokens being deposited to the job, which will create a new contribution to the job

params._approvers: the array of addresses who will be the approvers of the job
params._ipfsHash: the IPFS hash representing the JSON object storing the details of the job (see docs for schema details)
params._issuers: the array of addresses who will be the issuers of the job
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)
params._token: the address of the token which will be used for the job
params._tokenVersion: the version of the token being used for the job (0 for ETH, 20 for ERC20, 721 for ERC721)

refundContribution(address,uint256,uint2.details: refundContribution(): Allows users to refund the contributions they've                            made to a particular job, but only if the job                            has not yet paid out

params._contributionId: the index of the contribution being refunded
params._issuerId: the issuer id for thre job
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

refundContributions(address,uint256,uint.details: refundContributions(): Allows users to refund their contributions in bulk

params._contributionIds: the array of indexes of the contributions being refunded
params._issuerId: the index of the issuer who is making the call
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

refundMyContributions(address,uint256,ui.details: refundMyContributions(): Allows users to refund their contributions in bulk

params._contributionIds: the array of indexes of the contributions being refunded
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

replaceApprovers(address,uint256,uint256.details: replaceApprovers(): Allows any of the issuers to replace the approvers of the job

params._approvers: the array of addresses to replace the list of valid approvers
params._issuerId: the index of the issuer who is calling the function
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

replaceIssuers(address,uint256,uint256,a.details: replaceIssuers(): Allows any of the issuers to replace the issuers of the job

params._issuerId: the index of the issuer who is calling the function
params._issuers: the array of addresses to replace the list of valid issuers
params._sender: the sender of the transaction issuing the job (should be the same as msg.sender unless the txn is called by the meta tx relayer)

setMetaTxRelayer(address).details: setMetaTxRelayer(): Sets the address of the meta transaction relayer

devdoc.title: EthlanceJob

drainJob(address,uint256,uint256,uint256.notice: when using this function, if an issuer doesn't drain the entire balance, some users may be able to refund their contributions, while others may not (which is unfair to them). Please use it wisely, only when necessary
